dt: {bc}able to exist for a long time without significant deterioration in quality or value

pt: {sc}lasting{/sc} {sc}permanent{/sc} {sc}durable{/sc} {sc}stable{/sc} mean enduring for so long as to seem fixed or established. {sc}lasting{/sc} implies a capacity to continue indefinitely.

pt.t: a book that left a {it}lasting{/it} impression on me

pt: {sc}permanent{/sc} adds usually the implication of being designed or planned to stand or continue indefinitely.
{sc}durable{/sc} implies power to resist destructive agencies.
{sc}stable{/sc} implies lastingness because of resistance to being overturned or displaced.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}durabilis{/it}, from {it}durare{/it} to last {ma}{mat|during|}{/ma}
shortdef: able to exist for a long time without significant deterioration in quality or value; also : designed to be durable
